findings.title: Organizational Overview
findings.description: Dilasa Janvikas Pratishthan is a Civil Society organization established in 1994, focusing on sustainable rural development programs.
key_points: Founded in 1994
Works in close cooperation with 25 smaller NGOs in Vidharbha and Marathwada regions
Operates in 84+ districts across 11 states
Impacted 2.6+ million beneficiaries across 8470+ villages

findings.title: Core Focus Areas
findings.description: The organization focuses on multiple development sectors with emphasis on natural resource management and sustainable agriculture.
findings.evidence: Based on organizational profile and website content
key_points: Natural resource management
Climate resilient agriculture
Model village development
Health and education initiatives
Livelihood enhancement
Women empowerment

findings.title: Major Achievements
findings.description: The organization has achieved significant impact across various programs and initiatives.
key_points: Treated over 7.82 lakh ha of land under watershed programs
Working with 4000 SHG's & over 40000 members
Created irrigation facility in more than 4500 acres through 102 Phad projects
Implemented standard package of practices involving 3000 farmers
Developed more than 750 nutritional Kitchen Gardens in 19 villages

findings.title: Recent Projects and Partnerships
findings.description: Recent collaborations and initiatives show continued growth and impact in 2023-2024
findings.evidence: Source: Recent news articles and project reports
key_points: Collaboration with ACC and Adani Foundation for cement nala bund construction in Gowari village
Implementation of watershed development projects in partnership with NABARD
CSR project implementation with DHFL in Phulambri block of Aurangabad
Climate proofing programme in Sonari village
Partnership with MCX for watershed development in Ghotka village

findings.title: Watershed Development Programs
findings.description: Comprehensive watershed development initiatives across multiple regions
key_points: Implementation of WDF projects in Jalkotwadi, Aliyabad and Manmodi watersheds
Coverage of 3318 ha area under watershed treatments
RSO role in assessing watershed projects in Ahmednagar & Nanded districts
Implementation of UPNRM project in Jalna district
Village Transformation Programme in 5 villages of Phulambri block
